title: Grades 9-10
subject: Essential Elements for English Language Arts (2024-)

document.title: Iowa Academic Standards Essential Elements for English Languange Arts

2C985386526F43B7AA5B58E3D55D2040.description:
Use general academic and domain- specific
words and phrases across contexts.

28623C14E8A6421EA8086F49F9B6F772.description:
Determine the intended meaning of multiple
meaning words.

F74DE2589ED244E190BFB8CD04CB59CE.description:
Demonstrate understanding of word
relationships and use.

EFBBA7EAA7E2459B9BD31C7285EF4544.description:
Consult reference materials (dictionaries, online
vocabulary supports) to clarify the meaning of
unfamiliar words encountered when reading.

51AFECC4BA574811BEAEB42752F12101.description:
Identify and use root words and the words that
result when affixes are added or removed.

59352BA29CB24FC7B0D2EDD1FE72E80A.description: Use context to determine the meaning of unknown.

AB9BBF8DFCC44F728D40850FA9C659D8.description: Vary syntax when writing and communicating.

FF28F68632D347C38E2FC7754F731408.description:
Use language to achieve desired outcomes
when communicating.

8FA78A509909429BB4F2DDC906ECB7A8.description:
Spell most single-syllable words correctly and
apply knowledge of word chunks in spelling longer
words.

1FF7A096C56E44D697D98091CF3459F4.description:
Use a comma and conjunction to combine two
simple sentences.

CE01BDC479E544018D6AC891B6526C58.description:
Demonstrate understanding of conventions of
standard English.

894AA20F17694C478020AC55CC0CDC28.description:
Use a variety of parts of speech (nouns, verbs,
pronouns, adjectives, and prepositions) in writing or
communication to convey information.

7848F9A56F444593858FC6EA307ECC29.description:
Demonstrate standard English grammar and
usage when communicating.

7AD71A3BD8104F0AB9C9ABF90F9D7F0A.description:
Adapt communication to a variety of
contexts and tasks using complete sentences when
indicated or appropriate.

6E9E6E33A60A4D9784F46FD0EEF04F0F.description:
Use digital media (e.g., textual, graphical,
audio, visual, and interactive elements) in presentations to
support understanding.

496BAF11B2604BDA9EF9875773F19A89.description:
Present an argument on a topic with logically
organized claims, reasons, and evidence.

75AB573A50904FE589848712BC0D1F92.description:
Determine the speaker's point of view on a
topic.

2AEAF4B787E04FCFBAC836BD74174178.description:
Determine the credibility of information
presented in diverse media or formats.

EC5016EB6F234CB58DB858BC76140A75.description:
Indicate agreement or disagreement with others
during discussions.

148F3D6D48E44808BFE4D895CBB67556.description:
Relate the topic of discussion to broader themes or
ideas.

99DF49030A91484A9DA87D92D8D3FB23.description:
Work with adults and peers to set rules for
discussions.

1B32367396C0447C87D489C9EEA06AE6.description:
Prepare for discussions by collecting information
on the topic.

5E33FBF11ABB4C77B8BF8BEBE38251A1.description:
Write routinely over time for a range of tasks,
purposes, and audiences.

ECD11EA86103474CB8FBC6D0FE9627A5.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 9-10 Reading
Standards to informational texts (e.g., “Use sound
reasons for supporting the claims and argument.”).

D324F83404004FBB9F5D741FBF589AF8.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 9-10 Reading
Standards to literature (e.g., “Identify when an
author has drawn upon or included references to
another text.”).

DA81FD6C138F44078CB190EA64AC1C47.description:
Use information from literary and
informational text to support writing.

3EAB664D899E4AE2AA655A4EE95719D7.description:
Write answers to research questions by
selecting relevant information from multiple resources.

5F7B4C6763AA4C428A294AB66E688519.description:
Conduct research projects to answer
questions posed by self and others using multiple sources
of information.

C7272CDC5540444AAD37C044DEC4CFA0.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

5E150776F4194600A1E8C06CCF8BD647.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to
produce publish, and update individual or shared writing
products.

FEF1CBCAE1E84CCFB9601FFE438DDD79.description:
Develop writing by planning and revising own
writing.

467807F0B92F4233996022FCC0906675.description:
Produce writing that is appropriate for the
task, purpose, and audience.

B1E3026ACFCE42EF96F1D422679361C2.description:
Use descriptive words and phrases to convey a
vivid picture of experiences, events, setting, or
characters.

B4BFCEF0C5B24E1FBA87C6A6E7618533.description:
Organize the events in the narrative using
temporal words to signal order as appropriate.

B590B97DE11A453C808A53BB751DC877.description:
Write a narrative about a problem, situation, or
observation including at least one character,
details, and clearly sequenced events.

5A09B30CE6864788BFEF1C08B4635843.description: Write about events or personal experiences.

6E31807E85384B3CA094C18E153BFECC.description: Providing a closing or concluding statement.

919C26166801444BB0D3A4E65385C832.description:
Use domain specific vocabulary when writing
claims related to a topic of study or text.

722E55E2B438487DAEA58CB6B168E39F.description: Use complete, simple sentences as appropriate.

66425ADDE9F84E5B947DF8066B7E1CC2.description: Develop the topic with facts or details.

0E23D16BC5834F1EAFCB14940B302431.description:
Introduce a topic clearly and use a clear
organization to write about it including visual,
tactual, or multimedia information as appropriate.

81EC6EC0122946F6AEDBD14F840AE1E8.description:
Write to share information supported by
details.

BC97BC240A5D4194A73C6A7EFD77D44B.description:
Introduce a topic or text and write one claim and
one counterclaim about it.

1C88F2F9E77641C68946A7884A9D5D6B.description: Write claims about topics or texts.

97382F64E2E449CE8D5B0C8AAC04754B.description:
Demonstrate understanding while actively
engaged in reading or listening to literary nonfiction.

3A41446B6E7643AE9A213C3D7055ED25.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

33FB7B824C7244CEA6B51A94692A5DA3.description:
Make connections between texts with related
themes and concepts.

D29F906CED9F4D2B8D98D9B15D4066E6.description:
Determine how the specific claims support
the argument made in an informational text.

6E1E69B407194C8B9F7388E775BE1E50.description:
Analyze two accounts of a subject told in
different mediums to determine how they are the same and
different.

16B3D0114EBA426B9CDC61E6B47F47FF.description:
Determine author’s point of view and compare
with own point of view.

1E7129E2E3DA408991B9C010DF747EB5.description:
Locate sentences that support an author’s
central idea or claim.

13695E7535244132BD714AA4A5503803.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases
as they are used in text, including common idioms,
analogies, and figures of speech.

DD02CEF7436C4F59AC94795CD06A0F34.description:
Determine logical connections between
individuals, ideas, or events in a text.

F72E475C5CCA4C74A190BFEA54E84711.description:
Determine the central idea of the text and
select details to support it.

8813DB7FDEA24AB2814DAEC58E30C717.description:
Determine which citations demonstrate what
the text says explicitly as well as inferentially.

B6D67876108446F1A202507C44BF320D.description:
Demonstrate understanding of a text while
actively engaged in reading or listening to stories, dramas,
or poems.

821ABBF8C8824FB9B0FAE3C96AA085BD.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

1AAF2F7DFE4F411E95295E24F1C01B9B.description:
Identify when an author draws upon or
references a different text.

9443D3F7A89C43DAA4F3F303A1B96FD1.description:
Compare the representation of a subject or
topic in two different artistic mediums (e.g., poetry and
illustration).

8ABD977EBEF44D5399F44D392BCFAC16.description:
Determine a point of view or cultural
experience in a work of literature from outside the United
States and compare it with own point of view or experience.

CBD8B99523D24F72835B7D1BAB812D31.description:
Identify where a text deviates from a
chronological presentation of events.

94029BEC4BA2496E8CCA0BC48E4F1A3E.description:
Determine the meaning of words and
phrases as they are used in a text, including idioms,
analogies, and figures of speech.

12CD1CAED4504B938C9392EAC3D49605.description:
Determine how characters change or
develop over the course of a text.

584C2D7B576845B2B08AC18C5CB3FDBD.description:
Recount events related to the theme or
central idea, including details about character and setting.

896381C73262423F8B1EA027762714AE.description:
Determine which citations demonstrate what
the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the
text.
